1.text: Brothers, if a man be overtaken in a fault, you which are spiritual, restore such an one in the spirit of meekness; considering yourself, lest you also be tempted.

2.text: Bear you one anotherâ€™s burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.

3.text: For if a man think himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceives himself.

4.text: But let every man prove his own work, and then shall he have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.

5.text: For every man shall bear his own burden.

6.text: Let him that is taught in the word communicate to him that teaches in all good things.

7.text: Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatever a man sows, that shall he also reap.

8.text: For he that sows to his flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption; but he that sows to the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting.

9.text: And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.

10.text: As we have therefore opportunity, let us do good to all men, especially to them who are of the household of faith.

11.text: You see how large a letter I have written to you with my own hand.

12.text: As many as desire to make a fair show in the flesh, they constrain you to be circumcised; only lest they should suffer persecution for the cross of Christ.

13.text: For neither they themselves who are circumcised keep the law; but desire to have you circumcised, that they may glory in your flesh.

14.text: But God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world is crucified to me, and I to the world.

15.text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision avails any thing, nor uncircumcision, but a new creature.

16.text: And as many as walk according to this rule, peace be on them, and mercy, and on the Israel of God.

17.text: From now on let no man trouble me: for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.

18.text: Brothers, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
